description:
Honestly it's very difficult to use this pared down simplified interface, especially when the options don't match any of the documentation found on their website or anywhere else. Why does it keep telling me to find PVR Add Ons when there are no PVR Add Ons? All the docs say to find PVR, even the Kodi interface says so right on screen, but in the very selfsame app there are no PVR Add Ons available.

I gave up on that and pointed Kodi at my photos. I browsed to one photo using something like a file browser, which is fine but not exactly a beautiful type-specific software manager. When it came time to show the photo on screen, it took about fifteen seconds. What the heck is Kodi doing for fifteen seconds?

Fine so that doesn't seem to work very well, how about Music? I added my music library, Kodi scanned it, and... nothing. The music was nowhere to be found. Searched through settings and context menus and online forums for a long time, then gave up and just restarted Kodi. That fixed it, now Kodi shows Music. Why didn't it show Music all along? Especially when I configured it?

Alright anyway so I browsed to a song and clicked it. Is something supposed to happen? The song name turned orange and no sound was produced. I want a program that not only shows the names of my MP3s, but also plays them. I guess that's not what Kodi does? I guess not. My volume is up, other programs play audio, but Kodi can't manage to do it.

So it browses to photos but can barely show them. It can highlight MP3 names but can't play them. It can tell me that I need a PVR Add On, but it can't actually produce any PVR Add Ons. I literally couldn't get this software to do a single function. Every single function was broken. Nothing worked. I uninstalled it.

It's a shame because I used XBMC fifteen years ago and it worked great. It could definitely play MP3s back then. Things seems to have degraded.

Clearly some people get it to work, somehow, so it's two stars instead of one.
when will 21 omerta be here? last update was 10 months ago,,,
Works as expected. Happy
Tbh Kodi is a great application, it requires some tweaking to make it look nice/useful, but after that it gets the job perfectly done.
summary: great for the avarage linux user

description: seconds after it opens it crash's with segmentation fault. have tested 19.4 from ubuntu repo 19.4 from the ppa and 20.0 from ppa for jammy. been this way more then 6 months.

I used to have the same issue. Flatpak Kodi solved it, at least so far. Uninstall Kodi, then install from using flatpak. When a system update causes issues with Kodi, perform "flatpak upgrade tv.kodi.Kodi" in terminal.

Switching back to an X11 session and it opens fine.

description:
full of bugs so many why do not test your app before head

not worsh downlod could been goot but it is far away right know

I have been trying to use this software since it was called XBMC, i.e more than ten years.
It NEVER EVER WORKS!
Almost all addons fail to even start.
The program cannot be closed and this never gets fixed. It crashes the system every time, every release, year after year after year.
The addon installation concept is INSANE! Instead of browsing a software library or store and clicking "install" one must first add the repository containing the addon, and pretty much every addon has its own repository. It's like having a different library for every book: utterly stupid! But you can't just add a repository, you must add a url to your file manager as a "source" and then add the repository as an addon as a zip. It is so insane it beggars belief! But even when you get the repository installed there is no information about what the addons actually do! It's even worse than linux repositories where you are expected to search for an obscure file name instead of key words in the description. It's just crazy!
After the latest update, full screen no longer works, and I can't even uninstall it! (Using the flatpak verison)

Funny it works just PERFECT for me, Lots of people complaining! 
People are useing every day! but you, seem to have problems.

Its a great program!!  If you know how to make it work!

Lots of Info online if you need help!!

Great way to learn more about Linux....
summary: AWESOME It Does What I need It to Do

description:
Claims to be able to play video files from SMB shares over the network. VLC can both see my share and play the files, but Kodi keeps claiming my PC doesn't exist and isn't connected to the network. Dunno how it can claim that when VLC can see the PC just fine, but OK.
So I gave up trying to get it to recognize standard SMB shares like a functional program, and decided to try out Kodi's built-in UPnP feature. Installed it on my PC AND the android device I'm trying to view from, turned on all the UPnP stuff for both. Neither the PC nor the android device on the same network can see each other according to Kodi on either end.
Wasted 2 hours trying to accomplish a basic task the program was supposedly designed for. Meanwhile VLC did it instantly without issues or complaints.

All the time freezing, not closing, random sound problems.
So many versions. So little progress.
When is this going to be a STABLE version? (really meaning it)
summary: All the time freezing, not closing, random sound problems

description: BUY: Subtitles do not show up when switched on from the main screen. I have been using Kodi for years on Windows and never gave any truouble but on Ubuntu 23.04 appears bugged. Anyone experienced such bug? Kindly correct problem.
summary: Great best APP on all OS's

description: very clare imagen

To start, 3sc or the ... at the top is the back key, switch out of the program (it is full time TV mode) with alt+tab OR super(win) key. You have to manually go the the folder your media is in first and right click the folder, hit "set content" and tell the program which folder is movie, which is TV. the bottom right click settings and Refresh library, status should show at top right. It automatically organized your media by genra, director, studio, pulls thumbnails and EVERYTHING without adding plugins. This is dope as F***
also Kodi level volume control is on a by movie basis, when movie playing hit bottom right settings button, drag audio amplifier setting to appropriate level (make sure main vol is set where you want it first) i believe this setting is remember for each individual media file for later. 

a little "hard" to setup. BUT YOUR USING LINUX FIGURE IT OUT!
I was looking for a player that would play the music colection stored on Google Drive without pain in the butt. Here it is.
summary: Finally found the player i needed
